page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY _THE MUSEUM
page.content: The Northleach Cotswold Countryside Collection is situated between the A429 and the former A40. It costs 55p for adult admission, 35p for students and O.A.P's and 25p for children. It is open from 10am_5.30pm daily from April 1st_October 31st. It has a large car park holding a maximum of 37 cars. There are two glass_covered galleries and an outside exhibition containing old farm machinery, carts etc. There are wheelchair facilities and an open lawn in the centre. There is a prison which has examples of cells and details of a prisoner's life. There is a cafe, a shop selling brochures and other information. A new workshop is being built to cope with new exhibits. It is a clean, tidy and worthwhile place to visit, and an inexpensive museum.
